intro: Stephanodaphne cremostachya subsp. cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stephanodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
